alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 1:15PM EDT until March 27 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 106 PM EDT, The readings on the automated gauge on the Little Muskingum at Bloomfield River indicated the flood stage of 16 feet will be surpassed. Route 26, near the intersection with Route 260, begins to flood between 16 and 20 feet. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Washington County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
